t: Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld he burned the bones of the king of Edom to lime.
But*ld I will send a fire upon Moab, And*ld it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth; Moab*ld shall die with tumult, With*ld shouting and*i trumpet sound.
And*ld I will cut off the judge from its midst, And*ld slay all its princes with him,” Says*ld the Lord.*s

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they have despised the law of the Lord,*s And*ld have not kept His commandments. Their*ld lies lead them astray, Lies*ild which their fathers followed.
But*ld I will send a fire upon Judah, And*ld it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they sell the righteous for silver, And*ld the poor for a pair of sandals.
They*ld pant after the dust of the earth which*i is*i on the head of the poor, And*ld pervert the way of the humble. A*ld man and his father go in to the same*i girl, To*ld defile My holy name.
They*ld lie down by every altar on clothes taken in pledge, And*ld drink the wine of the condemned in*i the house of their god.

“Yet*ln it*i was*i I who*i destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose*ld height was*i like the height of the cedars, And*ld he was*i as*i strong as the oaks; Yet*ld I destroyed his fruit above And*ld his roots beneath.
Also*ld it*i was*i I who*i brought you up from the land of Egypt, And*ld led you forty years through the wilderness, To*ld possess the land of the Amorite.
I*ld raised up some of your sons as prophets, And*ld some of your young men as Nazirites. Is*ild it*i not so, O you children of Israel?” Says*ld the Lord.*s
“But*ld you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, And*ld commanded the prophets saying, ‘Do*ld not prophesy!’
“Behold,*ln I am weighed down by you, As*ld a cart full of sheaves is weighed down.
Therefore*ld flight shall perish from the swift, The*ld strong shall not strengthen his power, Nor*ld shall the mighty deliver himself;
He*ld shall not stand who handles the bow, The*ld swift of foot shall not escape, Nor*ld shall he who rides a horse deliver himself.
The*ld most courageous men of might Shall*ld flee naked in that day,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
